thag16.7:21.1: Giving up a valuable bronze bowl,
thag16.7:21.2: and a precious golden one, too,
thag16.7:21.3: I took a bowl made of clay:
thag16.7:22.1: I used to live in a citadel with walls so high,
thag16.7:22.4: and yet I trembled with fear.
thag16.7:23.1: Today I am fortunate, free of cowardice,
thag16.7:23.2: with fear and dread given up.
thag16.7:23.4: has plunged into the forest and practices absorption.
